edu.kit.cm.kitcampusguide.standardtypes
Class POI

java.lang.Object
  edu.kit.cm.kitcampusguide.standardtypes.POI
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class POI
extends Object
implements Serializable

Represents a POI. A POI can be any interesting point. POIs are uniquely defined. It is recommended to initialize the POIs from a single source or a single class to avoid discrepancy. Stores the id, the name, the description and the WorldPosition of the POI. Also stores the map the POI lies on, a collection of the categories the POI lies in and the building the POI represents. The id is unique and used to identify the POIs. If constructed from a consistent source, it can be used over the start and shutdown of the program. The name is shown to the user. It can be not-unique. The description is shown to the user to describe the POI. The WorldPosition of the POI is where the POI lies. The map is the map the POI lies on. The category-collection saved is the collection of all categories the POI lies in. It can be filtered by these. The building the POI represents. Each building should be identified by exactly one POI. The options for changing into that building and showing the POIs in that building will then be accessible via this POIs context menue.

Author:
fred
See Also:

Constructor Detail

POI

public POI(String id,
           String name,
           String description,
           WorldPosition position,
           Map map,
           Integer buildingID,
           Collection<Category> categories)
Constructs a new POI. To avoid discrepancies it is recommended to construct POIs from a consistent source and/or a single class.

Parameters:
id - The ID the POI has. Should be unique. However, this is not tested.
name - The name of the POI.
description - The description of the POI.
position - The position of the POI.
map - The map the POI lies on.
buildingID - The id of the building represented by the POI or null, if the POI doesn't represent a building.
categories - A collection of the categories the POI lies in.
Throws:
NullPointerException - If either id, name, description, position, map or categories is null.
Method Detail

getID

public String getID()
Returns the ID of the POI. It can be used to identify the POI and - if constructed from a consistent source - identify them between start and shutdown of the program. Used p.ex. to identify the building POI for each building.

Returns:
The ID of the POI.

getName

public String getName()
Returns the name of the POI. This is displayed to the user.

Returns:
The name of the POI.

getDescription

public String getDescription()
Returns the description of the POI. This is displayed to the user. Can contain html-code.

Returns:
The description of the POI.

getPosition

public WorldPosition getPosition()
Returns the position of the POI. This is used to print the POI via open layers.

Returns:
The position of the POI.

getMap

public Map getMap()
Returns the map the POI lies on. The POI is only displayed if it lies on the same map. Also used to identify which POIs to display if the POIs inside a building are displayed.

Returns:
The map the POI lies on.

getBuilding

public Building getBuilding()
Returns the building the POI represents. In this POIs context menu the option for changing into that building and to display the POIs inside that building will be availabe.

Returns:
The building the POI represents or null if the POI doesn't represent any.

getCategories

public Collection<Category> getCategories()
Returns a collection of the categories the POI lies in. Used to filter.

Returns:
A collection of the categories the POI lies in.
